page.title: 19RIVER LEADON
page.content: The River Leadon has its source at Evensbach near Ledbury and flows through a picturesque and winding valley to join the River Severn via a floodgate near Over Bridge. It forms a natural boundary between the parishes of Hartpury and Highleadon. In the past its flow drove the mills at Rudford, Upleadon and Hartpury. Collier's Brook joins the River Leadon at Wedderburn Bridge; the Bridge and Park Road were opened in 1908. The area today is used for recreation, by artists, and fishermen (for tench, roach, eel, pike). The Severn and Trent Water Authority are responsible for the maintenance of the watercourses and have recently dredged both the river and the brook to alleviate the problem of flooding in the surrounding area.
